common.errorDefault: An error has occurred, please try again later
common.name: Name

recipients.title: Recipients
recipients.noFound: No Recipients found for that search
recipients.tryDifferentSearch: Try entering a different search term.
recipients.editDesc: Make changes to your recipient settings
recipients.defaultTooltip: This is your account's default email address
recipients.canReplySendDesc: Toggle this option to determine whether this recipient is allowed to reply and send from your aliases. When set to off this recipient will not be able to reply or send from your aliases and you will be notified when an attempt is made.
recipients.hideSubjectDesc: Enabling this option will hide and encrypt the email subject using protected headers. Many mail clients are able to automatically decrypt and display the subject once the email arrives.
recipients.mustAddPGPKey: You must add a PGP key before you can use this setting.
recipients.inlineEncryptionDesc: Enabling this option will use (PGP/Inline) instead of the default PGP/MIME encryption for forwarded messages. Please Note: This will ONLY encrypt and forward the plain text content. Do not enable this if you wish to receive attachments or message with HTML content.
recipients.disableInlineFirst: You need to disable inline encryption before you can enable protected headers (hide subject)
recipients.disableProtectedFirst: You need to disable protected headers (hide subject) before you can enable inline encryption
recipients.enableEncryptionFirst: You must enable encryption first by adding a PGP key

usernames.title: Usernames
usernames.noFound: No Usernames found for that search
usernames.tryDifferentSearch: Try entering a different search term.
usernames.getStarted: Get started by creating a new username.
usernames.defaultTooltip: This is your account's default username
usernames.fromNameDesc1: The 'From Name' is shown when you send an email from an alias or reply anonymously to a forwarded email. If left blank, then the email alias itself will be used as the 'From Name'.
usernames.fromNamePriority: The 'From Name' that is used for an alias is determined by the following priority:
usernames.fromNamePriority3: Global 'From Name' from the settings page
usernames.fromNameOverride: If you set the 'From Name' for this username, it will override the global 'From Name' setting.
usernames.canLoginDesc: Toggle this option to determine whether this username can be used to login to your account or not. When set to off you will not be able to use this username to login to your account.
usernames.cannotDisallowDefault: You cannot disallow login for your default username
usernames.autoCreateRegexDesc1: If you wish to create aliases on-the-fly but don't want to enable catch-all then you can enter a regular expression pattern below. If a new alias' local part matches the pattern then it will still be created on-the-fly even though catch-all is disabled.
usernames.autoCreateRegexNote: Note: Catch-All must be disabled to use alias automatic creation with regex.
usernames.autoCreateRegexExample1: For example, if you only want aliases that start with "prefix" to be automatically created, use the regex:
usernames.autoCreateRegexExample2: If you only want aliases that end with "suffix" to be automatically created, use the regex:
usernames.autoCreateRegexExample3: If you want to make sure the local part is fully matched you can start your regex with and end it with e.g.:
usernames.autoCreateRegexHelp: You can use the following to help you write your regular expressions:
usernames.testAutoCreateRegexDesc1: You can test whether an alias local part will match the above regex pattern and be automatically created by entering the local part (left of @ symbol) below.
usernames.testAutoCreateRegexDesc2: No aliases will be created when testing.
usernames.testRegexMatch: The alias local part matches the regular expression and would be created
usernames.testRegexNoMatch: The alias local part does not match the regular expression and would not be created

domains.noFound: No Domains found for that search
domains.tryDifferentSearch: Try entering a different search term.
domains.getStarted: Get started by creating a new domain.
domains.fromNameDesc1: The 'From Name' is shown when you send an email from an alias or reply anonymously to a forwarded email. If left blank, then the email alias itself will be used as the 'From Name'.
domains.fromNamePriority: The 'From Name' that is used for an alias is determined by the following priority:
domains.fromNamePriority3: Global 'From Name' from the settings page
domains.fromNameOverride: If you set the 'From Name' for this domain, it will override the global 'From Name' setting.
domains.autoCreateRegexDesc1: If you wish to create aliases on-the-fly but don't want to enable catch-all then you can enter a regular expression pattern below. If a new alias' local part matches the pattern then it will still be created on-the-fly even though catch-all is disabled.
domains.autoCreateRegexNote: Note: Catch-All must be disabled to use alias automatic creation with regex.
domains.autoCreateRegexExample1: For example, if you only want aliases that start with "prefix" to be automatically created, use the regex:
domains.autoCreateRegexExample2: If you only want aliases that end with "suffix" to be automatically created, use the regex:
domains.autoCreateRegexExample3: If you want to make sure the local part is fully matched you can start your regex with and end it with e.g.:
domains.autoCreateRegexHelp: You can use the following to help you write your regular expressions:
domains.testAutoCreateRegexDesc1: You can test whether an alias local part will match the above regex pattern and be automatically created by entering the local part (left of @ symbol) below.
domains.testAutoCreateRegexDesc2: No aliases will be created when testing.
domains.testRegexMatch: The alias local part matches the regular expression and would be created

rules.name: Rule Name
rules.noFound: No Rules found for that search
rules.tryDifferentSearch: Try entering a different search term.
rules.getStarted: Get started by creating a new rule.

failedDeliveries.title: Failed Deliveries
failedDeliveries.descriptionSearch: Failed deliveries found for your search
failedDeliveries.descriptionAll: All failed deliveries in your account
failedDeliveries.noFailuresDesc: All emails have been delivered successfully.
failedDeliveries.noFound: No Failed Deliveries found for that search
failedDeliveries.tryDifferentSearch: Try entering a different search term.
failedDeliveries.moreInfoDesc1: Sometimes when the server attempts to send an email, the delivery is not successful. This is often referred to as a "bounced email".
failedDeliveries.moreInfoDesc2: This page allows you to see any failed deliveries relating to your account and the reason why they failed.
failedDeliveries.moreInfoDesc3: Only failed delivery attempts from the server to your recipients (or reply/send attempts from your aliases) will be shown here. It will not show messages that failed to reach the server from some other sender.
failedDeliveries.resendDesc1: You can choose to resend to the original recipient or select a different one below. You can choose multiple recipients.
failedDeliveries.resendDesc2: Leave the select input empty if you would like to resend to the original recipient
failedDeliveries.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this failed delivery?
failedDeliveries.deleteDesc: Failed deliveries are automatically removed when they are more than 7 days old. Deleting a failed delivery also deletes the email if it has been stored.

general.updateEmailDesc: This is your account's default recipient email address, it is used for all general email notifications. You'll need to verify the new email address by clicking the link in the email notification before it is updated.
general.darkModeThemeDesc: Choose your preferred theme for the web application.
general.updateDefaultAliasDomainDesc: The default alias domain is the domain you'd like to be selected by default in the drop down options when generating a new alias on the site or the browser extension. This will save you needing to select your preferred domain from the dropdown each time.
general.updateDefaultAliasFormatDesc: The default alias format is the format you'd like to be selected by default in the drop down options when generating a new alias on the site or the browser extension. This will save you needing to select your preferred format from the dropdown each time.
general.updateLoginRedirect: Update Page to Display After Login
general.updateLoginRedirectDesc: The login redirect determines which page you should be redirected to after logging in to your account. If you select "Aliases" then you will be shown the aliases page after you login to your account.
general.updateDisplayFromFormatDesc: The display from format is used when forwarding message to you. If one of your aliases receives an email from John Doe <johndoe[at]example.com> then you can choose how this will be displayed in your inbox.
general.useReplyToDesc1: This will determine if forwarded emails use the From header or the Reply-To header for sending replies. Some users may find it easier to set up inbox filters having the From: header set as just the alias.
general.useReplyToDesc2: If enabled, then the From: header will be set as the alias email e.g. alias[at]{username}.anonaddy.com instead of the default alias+sender=example.com[at]{username}.anonaddy.com (this will be set as the Reply-To header instead)
general.storeFailedDeliveriesDesc: This setting allows you to choose whether or not addy.io should temporarily store failed delivery attempts, this ensures that emails are not lost if they are rejected by your recipients as they can be downloaded from the failed deliveries page. Failed deliveries are automatically deleted after 7 days.
general.saveAliasLastUsedDesc: This setting allows you to choose whether or not addy.io should save the dates for last forwarded at, last replied at and last sent at for your aliases. You can view this information by hovering over the relevant count of each of these on the
general.updateSaveAliasLastUsed: Update Save Alias Last Used At
general.fromNameDesc: The 'From Name' is shown when you send an email from an alias or reply anonymously to a forwarded email. If left blank, then the email alias itself will be used as the 'From Name' e.g. "example[at]{username}.anonaddy.com".
general.fromNamePriorityTitle: The 'From Name' that is used for an alias is determined by the following priority:
general.fromNamePriority3: Global 'From Name' from the settings page
general.fromNameOverride: If you set the 'From Name' for a specific alias, it will override the other settings.
general.updateBannerLocationDesc: This is the information displayed in forwarded emails letting you know who the email was from and which alias it was sent to. You can choose for it to be displayed at the top or bottom of the email or just turn if off altogether.
general.replaceEmailSubjectDesc: This is useful if you are using encryption. After you add your public GPG/OpenPGP key for a recipient the body of forwarded emails will be encrypted (this includes email attachments). Unfortunately the email subject cannot be encrypted as it is one of the headers. To prevent revealing the contents of emails you can replace the subject with something generic below e.g. "The subject" or "Hello".
general.replaceEmailSubjectEmpty: If set to empty then the email's original subject will be used.

security.backupCodeEnabledAlert: 2FA successfully enabled! Please make a copy of your backup code below. If you have an old backup code saved you must update it with this one. If you lose your 2FA device you can use this backup code to disable 2FA on your account. This is the only time this code will be displayed, so be sure not to lose it!
security.updatePasswordDesc: Ensure your account is using a long, random, unique password to stay secure. It is recommended to use a password manager such as Bitwarden. Updating your password will also logout your active sessions on other browsers and devices.
security.browserSessionsDesc: If necessary, you may logout of all of your other browser sessions across all of your devices. If you feel your account has been compromised, you should also update your password.
security.twoFactorAuthDesc1: Two-factor authentication, also known as 2FA or multi-factor, adds an extra layer of security to your account beyond your username and password. There are multiple options for 2FA - 1. Authentication App (e.g. Google Authenticator or another, Aegis, andOTP) 2. Hardware Security Key (e.g. YubiKey, SoloKey, Nitrokey) 3. Passkeys (which can be stored in a supported provider such as Bitwarden or 1Password).
security.twoFactorAuthDesc2: When you login with 2FA enabled, you will be prompted to use a security key or enter a OTP (one time passcode) depending on which method you choose below. You can only have one method of 2nd factor authentication enabled at once.
security.generateBackupCodeDesc: The backup code can be used in a situation where you have lost your 2FA device to allow you to access your account. If you've forgotten or lost your backup code then you can generate a new one by clicking the button below. This code will only be displayed once so make sure you store it in a secure place. If you have an old backup code saved you must update it with this one.
security.backupCodeAlert: Please make a copy of your backup code below. If you have an old backup code saved you must update it with this one. If you lose your 2FA device you can use this backup code to disable 2FA on your account. This is the only time this code will be displayed, so be sure not to lose it!
security.disableTotpDesc: To disable TOTP authentication enter your password below. You can always enable it again later if you wish.
security.enableTotpDesc: TOTP two-factor authentication requires the use of Google Authenticator or another compatible app such as Aegis or andOTP (both on F-droid) for Android. Alternatively, you can use the code below. Make sure that you write down your secret code in a safe place.
security.regenerateSecret: Click here to regenerate your secret key
security.enableWebauthnDesc: WebAuthn is a new W3C global standard for secure authentication. You can use any hardware key such as a Yubikey, Solokey, NitroKey etc.
security.webauthnKeysDescWithTotp: Hardware security keys and Passkeys that you have registered for 2nd factor authentication. To remove a key simply click the delete button next to it. Disabled keys cannot be used to login. If you disable all keys Two-Factor Authentication will still be enabled as you have TOTP 2FA on your account.
security.webauthnKeysDescWithoutTotp: Hardware security keys and Passkeys that you have registered for 2nd factor authentication. To remove a key simply click the delete button next to it. Disabled keys cannot be used to login. If you disable all keys Two-Factor Authentication will be turned off on your account.
security.noKeysRegistered: You have not registered any keys.
security.disableKeyWarningNoOther: Once this key is disabled, Two-Factor Authentication will be disabled on your account as you do not have any other enabled keys.
security.disableKeyWarningTotp: Once this key is disabled, Two-Factor Authentication will still be enabled as you have TOTP 2FA on your account.
security.disableKeyWarningOther: Once this key is disabled, Two-Factor Authentication will still be enabled as you have other enabled keys on your account.
security.removeKeyWarningNoOther: Once this key is removed, Two-Factor Authentication will be disabled on your account as you do not have any other enabled keys.
security.removeKeyWarningTotp: Once this key is removed, Two-Factor Authentication will still be enabled as you have TOTP 2FA on your account.
security.removeKeyWarningOther: Once this key is removed, Two-Factor Authentication will still be enabled as you have other enabled keys on your account.

account.dangerZoneDesc: Once you delete your account, there is no going back. This username will not be able to be used again. Please make sure you are certain. Before deleting your account, please export any alias data or information that you wish to retain. For more information on what happens when you delete your account please see this
account.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to permanently delete your account and any aliases you've created?

data.importDesc1: You can import aliases for your custom domains by uploading a CSV file. Please note this is only available for custom domains.
data.importDesc2: Aliases that already exist will not be imported.
data.importDesc3: The import is limited to 1,000 rows (aliases). Please ensure you use multiple CSV files if you need to import more than this.
data.importDesc4: Please use the template file provided below. Only CSV files are supported.
data.importDesc5: The import will take a few minutes. You will receive an email once it is complete.
data.downloadTemplate: Click here to download the CSV import template
data.noCustomDomains: You don't have any custom domains
data.exportDesc: You can click the button below to export all the data for your {count} aliases as a .csv file.
data.noAliasesToExport: You don't have any aliases to export.

api.keysDesc: Your API access keys can be used with the browser extension on Firefox, Chrome, Edge and Safari to create new aliases. They can also be used with the official mobile apps. Simply paste a key you've created into the browser extension or mobile apps to get started. Your API access keys are secret and should be treated like your password. For more information please see the
api.keysListDesc: Keys you have created that can be used to access the API. To revoke an access key simply click the delete button next to it.
api.noTokens: You have not created any personal access tokens.
api.createKeyDesc: What's this API key going to be used for? Give it a short name so that you remember later. You can also select an expiry date for the key if you wish.
api.newKeyCreated: This is your new personal access key. This is the only time the key will ever be displayed, so please make a note of it in a safe place (e.g. password manager)!
api.qrCodeDesc: You can scan this QR code to automatically login to the addy.io mobile app.
api.revokeKeyDesc: Any browser extension, application or script using this API access key will no longer be able to access the API. This action cannot be undone.

validation.email: Please enter a valid email address
